SENT.plain: Fourteen women taking oral contraceptives were admitted during a five-year period because of acute cerebrovascular lesions
A diagnosis of major cerebral embolism was established in four of them
No source of embolism was found, and thorough investigation failed to reveal any predisposing illness
Cerebral embolism was a probable diagnosis in several of the remaining 10 patients
A comparison was made with the strokes occurring in women not taking contraceptive pills in corresponding age groups
